well.translation[0].definitions[0].defin: in a successful or satisfactory way
well.translation[0].definitions[0].examp: James reads quite well for his age.
All the team played very well today.
Simon doesn’t work well under pressure.
The festival was very well organized.
well.translation[0].definitions[1].examp: Mix the flour and butter well.
well.translation[0].definitions[2].defin: a lot, or to a great degree
well.translation[0].definitions[2].examp: The amphitheatre is well worth a visit.
I’m well aware of the problems involved.
I went out and got well and truly (=completely) drunk.
Stand well back from the bonfire.
It was well after 12 o'clock when they arrived.
The village is well below sea level.
well.translation[0].note_box[0].heading: – Meaning 3:
well.translation[0].note_box[0].sections: She’s been up since well before dawn.
It was well after ten o'clock when we arrived.
The school’s performance was well above average.
They earn well below $5 an hour.
This total falls well short of the sum required.
Stand well back from the edge of the platform.
The book is well worth reading.
I am well aware of the risks involved.
She is well able to look after herself.
The work on the extension is well underway.
well.translation[1].definitions[0].defin: used to emphasize something you are saying
well.translation[1].definitions[0].examp: Well, I think it’s a good idea anyway.
Well, I’ve had enough and I’m going home!
‘James doesn’t want to come to the cinema with us.’ ‘Well then, let’s go on our own.’
well.translation[1].definitions[1].defin: used to pause or give yourself time to think before saying something
well.translation[1].definitions[1].examp: Well, let’s see now, I could meet you on Thursday.
well.translation[1].definitions[2].defin: used to show that you accept a situation even though you feel disappointed or annoyed about it
well.translation[1].definitions[2].examp: Well, I did my best – I can’t do any more than that.
Oh well, we’ll just have to cancel the holiday, I suppose.
well.translation[1].definitions[3].defin: used to express surprise or amusement
well.translation[1].definitions[3].examp: Well, so Steve got the job?
Well, well, well, I didn’t think I’d see you here.
well.translation[1].definitions[4].defin: used to express anger or disapproval
well.translation[1].definitions[4].examp: Well, she could at least have phoned to say she wasn’t coming!
well.translation[1].definitions[5].defin: used to show that you are about to finish speaking or doing something
well.translation[1].definitions[5].examp: Well, that’s the last one done.
well.translation[1].definitions[6].defin: used to show that you are not sure about something
well.translation[1].definitions[6].examp: ‘Will you be in on Friday evening?’ ‘Well, it depends.’
well.translation[1].definitions[7].defin: used to slightly change something that you have said
well.translation[1].definitions[7].examp: He’s rolling in money! Well, he’s got a lot more than me, anyway.
well.translation[1].definitions[8].defin: used to continue a story you are telling people, especially in order to make it seem more interesting
well.translation[1].definitions[8].examp: You know that couple I was telling you about the other day? Well, last night I saw a police car in front of their house!
well.translation[2].definitions[0].defin: used to ask someone to answer a question you have asked them, when you are angry with them
well.translation[2].definitions[0].examp: Well? What have you got to say for yourself?
well.translation[3].definitions[0].examp: I hope you get well again soon.
well.translation[4].definitions[0].defin: a deep hole in the ground from which people take water
well.translation[4].definitions[0].examp: She lowered her bucket into the well.
well.translation[4].definitions[2].defin: the space in a tall building where the stairs are
well.translation[5].definitions[0].defin: if a liquid wells or wells up, it comes to the surface of something and starts to flow out
well.translation[5].definitions[0].examp: I felt tears well up in my eyes.
well.translation[5].definitions[1].defin: if a feeling wells or wells up in you, you start to feel it strongly
well.translation[6].definitions[0].defin: another name for an OIL WELL
